did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Files on early AIDS/insurance activism and ACT-UP files on health insurance; subject files pertaining to viatical settlements, financial planning, the New York State Health Care Reform bill, and the organizations New Yorkers for Affordable Health Care, and Affording Care.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Early member of Mariposa Foundation and later the head of Affording Care, a non-profit organization to help persons with AIDS get health insurance by cashing in life insurance policies.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Files on early AIDS/insurance activism and ACT-UP files on health insurance; subject files pertaining to viatical settlements, financial planning, the New York State Health Care Reform bill. Also files regarding the organizations New Yorkers for Affordable Health Care, Mariposa, and Affording Care.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: New Yorkers for Affordable Health Care.

controlaccess.head: Subjects:
controlaccess.subject: Gays--Law and legislation.
AIDS activists.
AIDS (Disease)--Law and legislation.
Viatical settlements.
Insurance, Health--Law and legislation.
Insurance, Life--Law and legislation
New York State Health Care Reform Bill.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: David Petersen papers, #7626. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: COLLECTION ARRANGEMENT
arrangement.p:
Where possible, original folder headings have been retained. The following are a list of common acronyms found in the guide:
BCBS: Blue Cross Blue Shield
EBCBS: Empire Blue Cross Blue Shield
GMHC: Gay Men's Health Center
HIAA: Health Insurance Association of America
PWAs: People With AIDS

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
ACT-UP
Health Care Changes/Reforms
Government Benefits
Financial Planning
Miscellaneous Insurance Materials

Series IV. AIDS and General Health Files
Boxes 5-6
